TestDescription.name: PHP version older than 5.2.1

WASPDescription.DetailsFormat: The script has been tested with these parameter values : ${combinations}

TestDescription.Description: [coolbox][dark]This alert was generated using only banner information. It may be a false positive. [/dark][/coolbox][break]This release is a major stability and security enhancement of the 5.X branch, and all users are strongly encouraged to upgrade to it as soon as possible. [break][break][bold]Security Enhancements and Fixes in PHP 5.2.1:[/bold][break][break][ul] [li]Fixed possible safe_mode & open_basedir bypasses inside the session extension.[/li] [li]Prevent search engines from indexing the phpinfo() page.[/li] [li]Fixed a number of input processing bugs inside the filter extension.[/li] [li]Fixed unserialize() abuse on 64 bit systems with certain input strings.[/li] [li]Fixed possible overflows and stack corruptions in the session extension.[/li] [li]Fixed an underflow inside the internal sapi_header_op() function.[/li] [li]Fixed allocation bugs caused by attempts to allocate negative values in some code paths.[/li] [li]Fixed possible stack overflows inside zip, imap & sqlite extensions.[/li] [li]Fixed several possible buffer overflows inside the stream filters.[/li] [li]Fixed non-validated resource destruction inside the shmop extension.[/li] [li]Fixed a possible overflow in the str_replace() function.[/li] [li]Fixed possible clobbering of super-globals in several code paths.[/li] [li]Fixed a possible information disclosure inside the wddx extension.[/li] [li]Fixed a possible string format vulnerability in *print() functions on 64 bit systems.[/li] [li]Fixed a possible buffer overflow inside mail() and ibase_{delete,add,modify}_user() functions.[/li] [li]Fixed a string format vulnerability inside the odbc_result_all() function.[/li] [li]Memory limit is now enabled by default.[/li] [li]Added internal heap protection.[/li] [li]Extended filter extension support for $_SERVER in CGI and apache2 SAPIs.[/li] [/ul][break][break][navy]Affected PHP versions (up to 5.2.0).[/navy][break]
TestDescription.Impact: Denial of service or ultimately arbitrary code execution.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Upgrade PHP to the latest version.
